apis.name: List issues
apis.description: Get all issues the authenticated user has access to. By default it returns only issues created by the current user. To get all issues, use parameter scope=all.

attributes.name: assignee_id
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the given user id. Mutually exclusive with assignee_username. None returns unassigned issues. Any returns issues with an assignee.

attributes.name: assignee_username
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the given username. Similar to assignee_id and mutually exclusive with assignee_id. In GitLab CE, the assignee_username array should only contain a single value. Otherwise, an invalid parameter error is returned.

attributes.name: author_id
attributes.description: Return issues created by the given user id. Mutually exclusive with author_username. Combine with scope=all or scope=assigned_to_me.

attributes.name: author_username
attributes.description: Return issues created by the given username. Similar to author_id and mutually exclusive with author_id.

attributes.name: confidential
attributes.description: Filter confidential or public issues.

attributes.name: created_after
attributes.description: Return issues created on or after the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: created_before
attributes.description: Return issues created on or before the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: due_date
attributes.description: Return issues that have no due date, are overdue, or whose due date is this week, this month, or between two weeks ago and next month. Accepts: 0 (no due date), any, today, tomorrow, overdue, week, month, next_month_and_previous_two_weeks.

attributes.name: epic_id
attributes.description: Return issues associated with the given epic ID. None returns issues that are not associated with an epic. Any returns issues that are associated with an epic. (Introduced in GitLab 13.6)

attributes.name: iids[]
attributes.description: Return only the issues having the given iid

attributes.name: in
attributes.description: Modify the scope of the search attribute. title, description, or a string joining them with comma. Default is title,description

attributes.name: issue_type
attributes.description: Filter to a given type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. (Introduced in GitLab 13.12)

attributes.name: iteration_id
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the given iteration ID. None returns issues that do not belong to an iteration. Any returns issues that belong to an iteration. Mutually exclusive with iteration_title. (Introduced in GitLab 13.6)

attributes.name: iteration_title
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the iteration with the given title. Similar to iteration_id and mutually exclusive with iteration_id. (Introduced in GitLab 13.6)

attributes.name: labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of label names, issues must have all labels to be returned. None lists all issues with no labels. Any lists all issues with at least one label. No+Label (Deprecated) lists all issues with no labels. Predefined names are case-insensitive.

attributes.name: milestone
attributes.description: The milestone title. None lists all issues with no milestone. Any lists all issues that have an assigned milestone. Using None or Any will be deprecated in the future. Please use milestone_id attribute instead. milestone and milestone_id are mutually exclusive.

attributes.name: milestone_id
attributes.description: Returns issues assigned to milestones with a given timebox value (None, Any, Upcoming, and Started). None lists all issues with no milestone. Any lists all issues that have an assigned milestone. Upcoming lists all issues assigned to milestones due in the future. Started lists all issues assigned to open, started milestones. milestone and milestone_id are mutually exclusive. (Introduced in GitLab 14.3)

attributes.name: my_reaction_emoji
attributes.description: Return issues reacted by the authenticated user by the given emoji. None returns issues not given a reaction. Any returns issues given at least one reaction.

attributes.name: non_archived
attributes.description: Return issues only from non-archived projects. If false, the response returns issues from both archived and non-archived projects. Default is true. (Introduced in GitLab 13.0)

attributes.name: not
attributes.description: Return issues that do not match the parameters supplied. Accepts: assignee_id, assignee_username, author_id, author_username, iids, iteration_id, iteration_title, labels, milestone, milestone_id and weight.

attributes.name: order_by
attributes.description: Return issues ordered by created_at, due_date, label_priority, milestone_due, popularity, priority, relative_position, title, updated_at, or weight fields. Default is created_at.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: Return issues for the given scope: created_by_me, assigned_to_me or all. Defaults to created_by_me.

attributes.name: search
attributes.description: Search issues against their title and description

attributes.name: sort
attributes.description: Return issues sorted in asc or desc order. Default is desc

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Return all issues or just those that are opened or closed

attributes.name: updated_after
attributes.description: Return issues updated on or after the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: updated_before
attributes.description: Return issues updated on or before the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: Return issues with the specified weight. None returns issues with no weight assigned. Any returns issues with a weight assigned.

attributes.name: with_labels_details
attributes.description: If true, the response returns more details for each label in labels field: :name, :color, :description, :description_html, :text_color. Default is false. The description_html attribute was introduced in GitLab 12.7

response.description: Ratione dolores corrupti mollitia soluta quia.
Ratione dolores corrupti mollitia soluta quia.
Ratione dolores corrupti mollitia soluta quia.

milestone.description: Ducimus nam enim ex consequatur cumque ratione.
milestone.title: v4.0

response.title: Consequatur vero maxime deserunt laboriosam est voluptas dolorem.

apis.name: List group issues
apis.description: Get a list of a group’s issues.

attributes.name: assignee_id

attributes.name: assignee_username
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the given username. Similar to assignee_id and mutually exclusive with assignee_id. In GitLab CE, the assignee_username array should only contain a single value. Otherwise, an invalid parameter error is returned.

attributes.name: author_id
attributes.description: Return issues created by the given user id. Mutually exclusive with author_username. Combine with scope=all or scope=assigned_to_me.

attributes.name: author_username
attributes.description: Return issues created by the given username. Similar to author_id and mutually exclusive with author_id.

attributes.name: confidential
attributes.description: Filter confidential or public issues.

attributes.name: created_after
attributes.description: Return issues created on or after the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: created_before

attributes.description: Return issues that have no due date, are overdue, or whose due date is this week, this month, or between two weeks ago and next month. Accepts: 0 (no due date), any, today, tomorrow, overdue, week, month, next_month_and_previous_two_weeks.

attributes.name: epic_id
attributes.description: Return issues associated with the given epic ID. None returns issues that are not associated with an epic. Any returns issues that are associated with an epic. (Introduced in GitLab 13.6)

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: iids[]
attributes.description: Return only the issues having the given iid

attributes.name: issue_type
attributes.description: Filter to a given type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. (Introduced in GitLab 13.12)

attributes.name: iteration_id
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the given iteration ID. None returns issues that do not belong to an iteration. Any returns issues that belong to an iteration. Mutually exclusive with iteration_title. (Introduced in GitLab 13.6)

attributes.name: iteration_title
attributes.description: Return issues assigned to the iteration with the given title. Similar to iteration_id and mutually exclusive with iteration_id. (Introduced in GitLab 13.6)

attributes.name: labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of label names, issues must have all labels to be returned. None lists all issues with no labels. Any lists all issues with at least one label. No+Label (Deprecated) lists all issues with no labels. Predefined names are case-insensitive.

attributes.name: milestone
attributes.description: The milestone title. None lists all issues with no milestone. Any lists all issues that have an assigned milestone.

attributes.name: my_reaction_emoji
attributes.description: Return issues reacted by the authenticated user by the given emoji. None returns issues not given a reaction. Any returns issues given at least one reaction.

attributes.name: non_archived
attributes.description: Return issues from non archived projects. Default is true. (Introduced in GitLab 12.8)

attributes.name: not
attributes.description: Return issues that do not match the parameters supplied. Accepts: labels, milestone, author_id, author_username, assignee_id, assignee_username, my_reaction_emoji, search, in

attributes.name: order_by
attributes.description: Return issues ordered by created_at, updated_at, priority, due_date, relative_position, label_priority, milestone_due, popularity, weight fields. Default is created_at

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: Return issues for the given scope: created_by_me, assigned_to_me or all. Defaults to all.

attributes.name: search
attributes.description: Search group issues against their title and description

attributes.name: sort
attributes.description: Return issues sorted in asc or desc order. Default is desc

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Return all issues or just those that are opened or closed

attributes.name: updated_after
attributes.description: Return issues updated on or after the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: updated_before
attributes.description: Return issues updated on or before the given time. Expected in ISO 8601 format (2019-03-15T08:00:00Z)

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: Return issues with the specified weight. None returns issues with no weight assigned. Any returns issues with a weight assigned.

attributes.name: with_labels_details
attributes.description: If true, the response returns more details for each label in labels field: :name, :color, :description, :description_html, :text_color. Default is false. The description_html attribute was introduced in GitLab 12.7

apis.name: New issue
apis.description: Creates a new project issue.

attributes.name: assignee_id
attributes.description: The ID of the user to assign the issue to. Only appears on GitLab Free.

attributes.name: assignee_ids
attributes.description: The IDs of the users to assign the issue to.

attributes.name: confidential
attributes.description: Set an issue to be confidential. Default is false.

attributes.name: created_at
attributes.description: When the issue was created. Date time string, ISO 8601 formatted, for example 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Requires administrator or project/group owner rights.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.

attributes.name: discussion_to_resolve
attributes.description: The ID of a discussion to resolve. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark the discussion as resolved. Use in combination with merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of.

attributes.name: due_date
attributes.description: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD, for example 2016-03-11

attributes.name: epic_id
attributes.description: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

attributes.name: epic_iid
attributes.description: IID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. (deprecated, scheduled for removal in API version 5)

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of the project’s issue (requires administrator or project owner rights)

attributes.name: issue_type
attributes.description: The type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. Default is issue.

attributes.name: labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names for an issue

attributes.name: merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of
attributes.description: The IID of a merge request in which to resolve all issues. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark all discussions as resolved. When passing a description or title, these values take precedence over the default values.

attributes.name: milestone_id
attributes.description: The global ID of a milestone to assign issue. To find the milestone_id associated with a milestone, view an issue with the milestone assigned and use the API to retrieve the issue’s details.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title of an issue

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

apis.name: Edit issue
apis.description: Updates an existing project issue. This call is also used to mark an issue as closed.

attributes.name: add_labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names to add to an issue.

attributes.name: assignee_ids
attributes.description: The ID of the users to assign the issue to. Set to 0 or provide an empty value to unassign all assignees.

attributes.name: confidential
attributes.description: Updates an issue to be confidential

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.

attributes.name: discussion_locked
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the issue’s discussion is locked. If the discussion is locked only project members can add or edit comments.

attributes.name: due_date
attributes.description: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD, for example 2016-03-11

attributes.name: epic_id
attributes.description: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

attributes.name: epic_iid
attributes.description: IID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. (deprecated, scheduled for removal in API version 5)

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

attributes.name: issue_type
attributes.description: Updates the type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case.

attributes.name: labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names for an issue. Set to an empty string to unassign all labels.

attributes.name: milestone_id
attributes.description: The global ID of a milestone to assign the issue to. Set to 0 or provide an empty value to unassign a milestone.

attributes.name: remove_labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names to remove from an issue.

attributes.name: state_event
attributes.description: The state event of an issue. Set close to close the issue and reopen to reopen it

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title of an issue

attributes.name: updated_at
attributes.description: When the issue was updated. Date time string, ISO 8601 formatted, for example 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z (requires administrator or project owner rights). Empty string or null values are not accepted.

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. 0

apis.name: Delete an issue
apis.description: Only for administrators and project owners. Deletes an issue.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

apis.name: Reorder an issue
apis.description: Reorders an issue, you can see the results when sorting issues manually

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of the project’s issue

attributes.name: move_after_id
attributes.description: The ID of a project’s issue that should be placed after this issue

attributes.name: move_before_id
attributes.description: The ID of a project’s issue that should be placed before this issue

apis.name: Move an issue
apis.description: Moves an issue to a different project. If the target project is the source project or the user has insufficient permissions, an error message with status code 400 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

attributes.name: to_project_id
attributes.description: The ID of the new project

apis.name: Clone an issue
apis.description: Clone the issue to given project. If the user has insufficient permissions, an error message with status code 400 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user.

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: Internal ID of a project’s issue.

attributes.name: to_project_id
attributes.description: ID of the new project.

attributes.name: with_notes
attributes.description: Clone the issue with notes. Default is false.

apis.name: Subscribe to an issue
apis.description: Subscribes the authenticated user to an issue to receive notifications. If the user is already subscribed to the issue, the status code 304 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

response.title: Sit voluptas tempora quisquam aut doloribus et.

apis.name: Unsubscribe from an issue
apis.description: Unsubscribes the authenticated user from the issue to not receive notifications from it. If the user is not subscribed to the issue, the status code 304 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue
